Package memory

Interface RAM

All Known Subinterfaces:
CodeReader, CodeWriter
All Known Implementing Classes:
Memory
public interface RAM
Interface for a Random Access Memory object which is, in essence, responsible for storing and retrieving values. Since the methods have int arguments and return values, each cell holds, at most 32-bit values. However, it is possible to store only a 16-bit value per cell, or even two 16-bit values per cell, one in the low and one in the high bits of each cell.

Note: this interface is rather limited and poorly designed as the need for it became apparent at the later stages of development and was therefore tailored to the specific needs of this application. It may or may not be improved in the future.

Author:
Alex Mandelias

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default void
    clear()
    Clears the RAM, resetting every value to 0
    int

    Reads a value from RAM.
    char[]

    Reads an array of values from RAM.
    int

  • Method Details

    • size

      int size()
      Returns the size of the RAM, the number of 32-bit values it can store.
      Returns:
      the size

    • write

      void write​(int address, int value)
      Writes the value in the address.
      Parameters:
      address - the address in RAM
      value - the value to write in the address

    • writeChars

      void writeChars​(int address, char[] values)
      Writes an array of char values starting at address.
      Parameters:
      address - the address of the first value
      values - the array of values to write
      Implementation Note:
      implementations must ensure that all the metadata surrounding the values (e.g. size) is saved when writing and that it can be properly retrieved when reading. The protocol used in this method must be consistent with the one used in the readChars(int) method.

    • read

      int read​(int address)
      Reads a value from RAM.
      Parameters:
      address - the address in RAM to read from
      Returns:
      the value in that address

    • readChars

      char[] readChars​(int address)
      Reads an array of values from RAM.
      Parameters:
      address - the address of the first value
      Returns:
      the array of the values read
      Implementation Note:
      implementations must ensure that the correct values are read according to the metadata stored by the writeChars(int, char[]) method.

    • clear

      default void clear()
      Clears the RAM, resetting every value to 0
